result.execSummary:
The defendant Lindsay R Daffinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or civil judgment.
Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.
No firearms; weapons, during period of probation.
No contact with victim, without prior court approval.

Successfully complete Anger Management, and continue programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety. No drugs. No alcohol.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
Restitution is set at zero.
Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lindsay R Daffinson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lindsay R Daffinson not in court.  Carole R. Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DEFENDANT IS DECEASED.
ANY FINE/FORFEITURES, COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES TO BE WAIVED.
ANY OUTSTANDING CIVIL JUDGMENTS, FINE & COST COMMITMENTS, SUSPENSIONS FOR DRIVING PRIVILEGES TO BE VACATED AND/OR WITHDRAWN.

DOC notice of case status change.
Probation/Extended Supervision status:  
(  ) Revoked             (  ) Discharged   ( X ) DECEASED
(  ) Discharge Certificate Filed.
Effective date:  10-20-2014            Initials:   AAC

Email from DOC Agent Rabekah Polasky to advise that the defendant has passed away, per her agent.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled in Branch 4 on 10-10-2014 at 1:30 pm is cancelled per request of agent.   mld
Probation Review Hearing rescheduled from 8-8-2014 at 1:30 pm, Branch 4 to 10-10-2014 at 1:30 pm, due to the unavailability of the Court.   mld

Defendant Lindsay R Daffinson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Abbey M DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Courts finds that State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

 AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1: Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS (CONSECUTIVE to count #2), in the House of Correction with credit for 5 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS. 

AS TO COUNT #2: Defendant sentenced to serve 90 DAYS (CONSECUTIVE to count #1), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 2 YEARS. 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 60 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete Anger Management, 
   and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No contact with victim, without prior court approval.  
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school.
* No firearms; weapons, during period of probation.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the DNA surcharge and 
   supervision fees as determined by the Department of 
   Corrections, during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 4 ON 8-8-2014 AT 1:30 PM.

  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   mld
dated 5-12-2014, addressed to the Court from Steven Daffinson, relative of the defendant, received and filed.   mld

AS TO AMENDED COUNT #1 and COUNT #2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  The State is prepared to proceed to sentencing, defense is requesting an adjournment, defendant is in the process of enrolling in counsel with Impact.  State is not opposed to adjourning case for Sentencing.  Case adjourned for Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 5-22-2014 at 8:30 am.  

The State spoke with the father of the victim and he is requesting that the current no contact order remain in effect.  Court maintains the current no contact order.  

The Court ordered defendant to have no violations of the law and no contact with the named parties on the complaint.   mld

Defendant Lindsay R Daffinson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Abbey M DeSiato appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
  Amended Information, received and filed.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court AMENDED the sole charge to (2) two seperate counts of Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin State Statutes 947.01(1) a Class B Misdemeanor."  mld

Defendant Lindsay R Daffinson in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Matthew J. Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Discovery and offer received by defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-22-2014 at 1:30 pm.   mld
Court ordered the following as conditions of bail: ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY, no drugs, no alcohol, take only prescribed medications and no violations of the law.   mld

Defendant Lindsay R Daffinson in court with attorney Alejandro A Lockwood.  Matthew Torbenson appeared for Abbey DeSiato for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Defense counsel acknowledged receipt of discovery from the State.  Formal offer will be forthcoming to defense counsel, per the State.  Court ordered case adjourned for Pretrial Conference in Branch 04 on 3-11-2014 at 8:30 am.    mld
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with AA dob 4/5/01

Defendant Lindsay R Daffinson in court with attorney Reyna I Morales.  Defendant Lindsay R Daffinson in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
~  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
